<Fragment set:html={`
          <section id="control-flow-structures">
<h1>Control flow structures<a class="headerlink" href="#control-flow-structures" title="Link to this heading">¶</a></h1>
<p>Control flow in Algorand Python is similar to standard Python control flow, with support for if statements, while loops, for loops, and match statements.</p>
<section id="if-statements">
`} />
## If statements

<Fragment set:html={`
<p>If statements work the same as Python. The conditions must be an expression that evaluates to bool, which can include a <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-types.html"><span class="std std-doc">String or Uint64</span></a> among others.</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">condition</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1"># block of code to execute if condition is True</span>
<span class="k">elif</span> <span class="n">condition2</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1"># block of code to execute if condition is False and condition2 is True</span>
<span class="k">else</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1"># block of code to execute if condition and condition2 are both False</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' /><Fragment set:html={`
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/algorandfoundation/puya/blob/main/test_cases/simplish/contract.py">See full example</a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="ternary-conditions">
`} />
## Ternary conditions

<Fragment set:html={`
<p>Ternary conditions work the same as Python. The condition must be an expression that evaluates to bool, which can include a <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-types.html"><span class="std std-doc">String or Uint64</span></a> among others.</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">value1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">UInt64</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">value2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">String</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"&gt;6"</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">value1</span> <span class="o">&gt;</span> <span class="mi">6</span> <span class="k">else</span> <span class="n">String</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"&lt;=6"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' /><Fragment set:html={`
</section>
<section id="while-loops">
`} />
## While loops

<Fragment set:html={`
<p>While loops work the same as Python. The condition must be an expression that evaluates to bool, which can include a <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-types.html"><span class="std std-doc">String or Uint64</span></a> among others.</p>
<p>You can use <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">break</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">continue</span></code>.</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="k">while</span> <span class="n">condition</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="c1"># block of code to execute if condition is True</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' /><Fragment set:html={`
<p>Note: we don’t currently have support for while-else statements.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/algorandfoundation/puya/blob/main/test_cases/unssa/contract.py#L32-L83">See full example</a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="for-loops">
`} />
## For Loops

<Fragment set:html={`
<p>For loops are used to iterate over sequences, ranges and <a class="reference internal" href="../lg-arc4.html"><span class="std std-doc">ARC-4 arrays</span></a>. They work the same as Python.</p>
<p>Algorand Python provides functions like <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uenumerate</span></code> and <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">urange</span></code> to facilitate creating sequences and ranges; in-built Python <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">reversed</span></code> method works with these.</p>
<ul class="simple">
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">uenumerate</span></code> is similar to Python’s built-in enumerate function, but for UInt64 numbers; it allows you to loop over a sequence and have an automatic counter.</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">urange</span></code> is a function that generates a sequence of Uint64 numbers, which you can iterate over.</p></li>
<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">reversed</span></code> returns a reversed iterator of a sequence.</p></li>
</ul>
<p>Here is an example of how you can use these functions in a contract:</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">test_array</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">arc4</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">StaticArray</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">arc4</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">UInt8</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">arc4</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">UInt8</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">arc4</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">UInt8</span><span class="p">(),</span> <span class="n">arc4</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">UInt8</span><span class="p">())</span>

<span class="c1"># urange: reversed items, forward index</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">item</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">uenumerate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">reversed</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">urange</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">))):</span>
    <span class="n">test_array</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">arc4</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">UInt8</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">item</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">test_array</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">bytes</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">Bytes</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">from_hex</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"03020100"</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' /><Fragment set:html={`
<p>Note: we don’t currently have support for for-else statements.</p>
<p><a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/algorandfoundation/puya/blob/main/test_cases/reversed_iteration/contract.py">See full</a> <a class="reference external" href="https://github.com/algorandfoundation/puya/blob/main/test_cases/nested_loops/contract.py">examples</a>.</p>
</section>
<section id="match-statements">
`} />
## Match Statements

<Fragment set:html={`
<p>Match statements work the same as Python and work for […]</p>
`} /><Code code={`<div class="highlight-python notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="k">match</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span>
    <span class="k">case</span> <span class="n">pattern1</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="c1"># block of code to execute if pattern1 matches</span>
    <span class="k">case</span> <span class="n">pattern2</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="c1"># block of code to execute if pattern2 matches</span>
    <span class="k">case</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="k">_</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="c1"># Fallback</span>
</pre></div>
</div>`} lang='py' frame='none' />
